  "title": "Executive Technical Assistant",
  "description": "Addosser Investment Limited is a Group of Company with different subsidiaries that rendersFinancial Solutions Services for Individual, Business owners and Corporate Institutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Technical Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized and tech-savvy Executive / Technical Assistant to provide high-level administrative, technical, and strategic support to the MD.
	This role requires not only traditional EA responsibilities but also strong technical acumen, proficiency in data visualization tools, and exceptional presentation skills.
	The ideal candidate should be able to act as a Technical Assistant, support business operations, and deliver executive-level presentations.


Responsibilities
Executive Support:


	Attending meetings in the Office of the MD, as required, in order to capture the key points of discussion. Following up post completion, in order to ensure that the directives issued are accomplished in a timely manner.
	Act as a liaison between the MD and internal/external stakeholders, including strategic partners.
	Support new product development, equity raise and strategic partnerships.
	Assist in the preparation and maintenance of strategic documents, presentations, and reports.
	Update the MD on critical information as it arises, track project progress, and ensure that milestones are achieved on time.
	Coordinating and attending Committee Meetings Chaired by the MD in order to ensure that the technical aspects are covered, and minutes prepared for closure and subsequent follow up.


Technical Support &amp; Analysis:


	Provide technical support in preparation of presentations, correspondences, and reports in a timely manner.
	Perform frequent and rigorous research on key Business topics both internally and externally to identify organization&#39;s fitment to strategic frameworks, establish industry trends, and collect benchmark data.
	Provide research and data analysis support to aid decision-making.
	Prepare dashboards, performance metrics, and project reports using Excel, Power BI, or similar tools.
	Collaborate with internal teams to gather, validate, and interpret data for presentations.


Presentation &amp; Communication:


	Create high-quality PowerPoint presentations for internal and external stakeholders.
	Ensure branding and messaging consistency across executive materials.
	Assist with speech writing and talking points preparation for key engagements.


Operational &amp; Project Assistance:


	Track strategic projects and provide status updates to the Executive Team.
	Work closely with the Strategy team to ensure smooth coordination and tracking of strategic activities with the MD&rsquo;s schedule.
	Coordinate with cross-functional departments to ensure timely execution of initiatives.
	Draft correspondence, reports, and policy documents as required.


Requirenments


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or Technical Assistant.
	Experience working with senior executives and handling high-stakes communications.
	Experience in a tech-driven or fast-paced corporate environment.


Required Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially PowerPoint and Excel).
	Knowledge of tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio is a plus.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Exceptional organizational and time management abilities.
	High attention to detail and a proactive problem-solving mindset.
	Discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks efficiently.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@addosser.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Operations Officer Job at Bridge Credit Limited




        
    

        
        Bridge Credit Limited is a leading consumer credit company established to offer Nigerians convenient and easy access to loans, to enable them meet personal financial obligations, including asset acquisition as well as provide working capital to support productive ideas that would expand their sources of income and increase their standard of living. Right from the outset, our focus has been to reshape the non-bank financial sector by delivering solutions to customers’ credit needs innovatively, departing from traditional bureaucracy which brings bottlenecks to a more business-oriented and customer-friendly approach, while maintaining credit discipline and remaining committed to our corporate objectives which is to deliver sustainable value to all our stakeholders.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos (Hybrid)
Industry: Financial Services

Summary


	Bridge Credit Limited is recruiting an Operations Officer to support its expanding operations team.
	This role is ideal for a detail-oriented professional with experience in loan booking, reconciliations, and credit transaction management.


Job Summary


	Accurately book of disbursed customer loans on core banking application (CBA)
	Credit transaction updates
	Reconcile loan product portfolios and generate timely reports
	Respond to customer complaints and enquiries within TAT
	Liquidate loans after verifying payment confirmations
	Handle loan booking issues/enquiries from internal audit and finance
	Attend to credit transaction issues and resolve within TAT


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree in Accounting or related field
	2 - 4 years of experience in a fintech or microfinance institution
	Professional qualifications (ACA, ACCA) are an added advantage
	Relevant experience in financial services and knowledge of regulatory standards
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office suites (Excel, PowerPoint, etc).


Salary
Attractive.

Treasury Accountant Job at Mantrac




        
    

        
        Mantrac is the sole distributor for Caterpillar products in Nigeria, distributing and supporting machinery, power systems and material-handling equipment. The company provides customers with comprehensive solutions, backed by technical know-how, experience and in-depth knowledge of their local markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Treasury Accountant

Job Location: Lagos

SumGeneral Optionsmary of Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Support in interpreting company credit policies and applying same in ensuring that receivable balances are kept within the targeted company threshold. Assist Credit Controller in ensuring the integrity of account receivable ledger.

Job Position: Senior Accountant

  "description": "Credpal is an innovative solution that seeks to combat the ever complex loan approval process that has deterred millions from achieving specific goals over the years. Job type: Full-time

	We are seeking a strategic and results-driven&nbsp;Mid- Senior Wealth Manager&nbsp;to lead CredPal&rsquo;s wealth and investment initiatives.
	This role will focus heavily on&nbsp;deposit mobilization, driving customer acquisition, retention, and deepening relationships with high-value clients to grow the company&rsquo;s investment portfolio.
	The ideal candidate will combine financial expertise with exceptional leadership skills to scale CredPal&rsquo;s wealth products and deliver sustainable revenue growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Deposit Mobilization:&nbsp;Drive aggressive mobilization of deposits from retail, SME, and institutional clients to fund CredPal&rsquo;s lending and investment activities.

	Risk Management:&nbsp;Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal risk policies in all wealth and investment activities.
	Revenue Growth:&nbsp;Develop strategies to grow assets under management (AUM) and increase recurring investment income.
	Client Acquisition &amp; Retention:&nbsp;Develop and execute strategies to acquire new high-net-worth clients and institutional investors while retaining and expanding existing relationships.
	Relationship Management:&nbsp;Build and manage strong relationships with clients, financial institutions, and strategic partners.
	Performance Tracking:&nbsp;Monitor KPIs, analyze performance data, and report progress to senior leadership.
	Collaboration:&nbsp;Work closely with marketing, credit, and product teams to ensure wealth solutions meet customer needs and align with CredPal&rsquo;s overall business objectives.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field (MBA or relevant professional certification such as CFA is a plus).
	Minimum 3 years of experience in wealth management, deposit mobilization, investment banking, or high-value client relationship management.
	Proven track record in achieving deposit mobilization and investment portfolio growth targets.
	Strong understanding of investment products, wealth advisory, and financial markets.
	Excellent leadership and people management skills.
	Strong negotiation, networking, and client relationship-building abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, CRM tools, and financial analytics software.
	High ethical standards and commitment to compliance and fiduciary responsibilities.


KPIs


	Monthly deposit mobilization target achievement.

	Number of high-value clients acquired and retained.
	Wealth product revenue growth.
	Client satisfaction and retention rate.


Benefits

	Professional development opportunities.
	A collaborative and inclusive work culture that fosters growth and innovation.
	Opportunity to work with cutting-edge products and technologies.
	Supportive and approachable management team dedicated to your success.


What to expect in the hiring process


	A preliminary phone call with a Recruiter
	A technical interview with the Head of Brand
	A business case assignment
	A business case presentation to the Head of Brand and the Chief Growth Officer.

	Deposit Mobilization: Drive aggressive mobilization of deposits from retail, SME, and institutional clients to fund CredPal’s lending and investment activities.
	Product Strategy: Optimization of wealth management and investment products.
	Market Research: Monitor financial market trends and competitor offerings to position CredPal’s wealth solutions competitively.
	Risk Management: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal risk policies in all wealth and investment activities.
	Revenue Growth: Develop strategies to grow assets under management (AUM) and increase recurring investment income.
	Client Acquisition & Retention: Develop and execute strategies to acquire new high-net-worth clients and institutional investors while retaining and expanding existing relationships.
	Relationship Management: Build and manage strong relationships with clients, financial institutions, and strategic partners.
	Performance Tracking: Monitor KPIs, analyze performance data, and report progress to senior leadership.
	Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, credit, and product teams to ensure wealth solutions meet customer needs and align with CredPal’s overall business objectives.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field (MBA or relevant professional certification such as CFA is a plus).
	Minimum 3 years of experience in wealth management, deposit mobilization, investment banking, or high-value client relationship management.
	Proven track record in achieving deposit mobilization and investment portfolio growth targets.
	Strong understanding of investment products, wealth advisory, and financial markets.
	Excellent leadership and people management skills.
	Strong negotiation, networking, and client relationship-building abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, CRM tools, and financial analytics software.
	High ethical standards and commitment to compliance and fiduciary responsibilities.


KPIs


	Monthly deposit mobilization target achievement.
	Growth in Assets Under Management (AUM).
	Number of high-value clients acquired and retained.
	Wealth product revenue growth.
	Client satisfaction and retention rate.


Benefits


	Competitive salary package N6,000,000.00 - N12,000,000.00 per year with performance-based incentives
	Professional development opportunities.
	A collaborative and inclusive work culture that fosters growth and innovation.
	Opportunity to work with cutting-edge products and technologies.
	Supportive and approachable management team dedicated to your success.


What to expect in the hiring process


	A preliminary phone call with a Recruiter
	A technical interview with the Head of Brand
	A business case assignment
	A business case presentation to the Head of Brand and the Chief Growth Officer.
